§ lfg-format

⸺ by Charles Iliya Krempeaux

The **lfg-format** is an **image** [[data-format]] created by **Charles Iliya Krempeaux**.

The **lfg-format** is meant to not only be [[human-legible]], [[programmer-legible]], and [[machine-legible]] — but it is also meant to be [[human-friendly]].

These concerns are places higher than things like file-size.
(Compression and other concerns are handled at other levels.)

"//LFG//" is an initialization of "//legible friendly graphics//".

The **lfg-format** is similar to the [[pbm-format]], the [[pgm-format]], the [[ppm-format]], the [[xbm-format]], and the [[xpm-format]].

Here is an example **lfg-format** image:

	LFG/1
	
	=width 8
	=height 16
	=color #55ffff ■
	=color #ff55ff □
	=magnification 25
	
	■■■■■■■■
	■□□■■■■■
	■□□■■■■■
	■□□■■■■■
	■□□■■■■■
	■□□■■■■■
	■□□■■■■■
	■□□■■■■■
	■□□■■■■■
	■□□■■■■■
	■□□■■■■■
	■□□■■■■■
	■□□■■■■■
	■□□□□□□□
	■□□□□□□□
	■■■■■■■■

A **lfg-format** image is a [[unicode]] [[utf-8]] file that starts with the "magic":

	LFG/1

It then has a number of name-value pairs.
You can tell a line is a name-value pair because it starts with an //equal-sign// ("=").

Certain //names// (for the name-value pairs) are special:

• ``width``
• ``height``
• ``color``
• ``magnification``

Empty lines are ignored.

There are 3 valid end-of-line characters:

• LF  (U+000A) (line-feed)
• NEL (U+0085) (next-line)
• LS  (U+2028) (line-separator)

The CR (U+000D) character is ignored.

end-of-line and spacing characters within image data is //not// significant.

For example, this is the same image as before:

	LFG/1
	=width 8
	=height 16
	=color #55ffff ■
	=color #ff55ff □
	=magnification 25
	■■■■■■■■■□□■■■■■■□□■■■■■■□□■■■■■■□□■■■■■■□□■■■■■■□□■■■■■■□□■■■■■■□□■■■■■■□□■■■■■■□□■■■■■■□□■■■■■■□□■■■■■■□□□□□□□■□□□□□□□■■■■■■■■
